articles.title: Rand left bleeding as dollar heads for best month since 2015 - News24
articles.description: The dollar has been boosted by a combination of expectations for US rate hikes and growth concerns in China and Europe.
articles.content:
After crashing through R16/$ on Thursday, the rand was slightly stronger at R15.90 on Friday morning.
The local currency has lost more than 10% of its value against the dollar so far this month. It … [+2228 chars]

articles.title: Warning of more cases of mystery hepatitis in children expected throughout Europe - Independent.ie
articles.description: More cases of mystery severe hepatitis in children, which has already struck a small number of young people in Ireland, are expected throughout Europe, a disease watchdog warned yesterday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Around 8,000 British troops to take part in biggest deployment in eastern Europe since Cold War - The Independent
articles.description: Dozens of tanks will also deployed to countries ranging from Finland to North Macedonia
articles.content:
The UK is sending around 8,000 of its troops to take part in exercises across eastern Europe in the wake of Russias invasion of Ukraine.

articles.title: Adults with asthma have a higher risk of developing obesity - EurekAlert
articles.description: A study with more than 8,700 participants from 11 European countries and Australia has concluded that adults with asthma are more likely to become obese later in life. The research has also shown the risk is higher among patients with non-allergic asthma, tho…
